revised_title: Awards and Achievements in Science: Avery, Bernal, and Salisbury
tldr: The President of the Royal Society, Sir Henry Dale, presents awards to Dr. Oswald Avery for his contributions to immunochemistry, Professor John Desmond Bernal for his work in X-ray crystal analysis, and Dr. Edward James Salisbury for his research in plant ecology. Avery's research on the pneumococcus led to the discovery of a chemical principle that induces genetic transformation. Bernal's work in X-ray crystallography helped elucidate the structures of complex organic molecules and proteins. Salisbury's studies on plant communities and autecology have broadened the understanding of British plant habitats and species' reproductive efficiency.
